column3: Working With A CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ Professional&lt
column5: When choosing a financial advisor to help you meet your wealth management goals, consider the benefits of working with someone that is&amp
to individuals that have met rigorous educational, testing, and ethical standards.
certification, individuals must complete a comprehensive course of study at an approved college or university covering a multitude of financial planning topics, including:

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP
Board and violation of these principles can result in the revocation of the designation.

column3: Why It Should Matter to You&lt
column5: There are a variety of attributes that you can expect from an advisor with the CFP

column3: being well-versed in developing integrated wealth management plans
a robust theoretical and practical knowledge of investment products and services
an unwavering commitment to the highest ethics
a steadfast commitment to putting your interests first.&lt
We encourage you to experience the benefits of working with a CFP&lt
column11: today to learn more or to schedule a complimentary consultation.&lt

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP

column7: Participating in our community by working with charitable organizations and collaborating with other businesses and economic development agencies is integral to our lives and approach to business. Please see the information below regarding some of the organizations we support and are involved with:&lt

column11: provides comprehensive housing, support and educational services to anyone in the Southern Berkshire region who has lost his or her home or who lacks adequate financial resources to maintain safe, decent and affordable housing.&lt

column1: Terry serves as a member of the board of Construct and is on the finance committee. In addition to providing a $250 matching grant for employee donations to Construct, &lt
column7: RBC Wealth Management Foundation has generously granted $5,000 in each of the last two years to fund essential programming provided by the organization.&lt

column9: is the first residential therapeutic community in the nation dedicated to helping adults with mental illness move toward recovery, health and greater independence through community living, meaningful work and individual care.&lt

column1: Terry and his wife Monica have actively supported Gould Farm for many years. Monica serves on the board and is a member of the executive committee.&lt

column9: is a community-driven solution to our regional problem of inadequate broadband. They&amp
column11: re dedicated to building a community-owned, state of the art, fiber-optic network to serve the last mile in the Berkshires.&lt

column1: In addition to providing financial support to WiredWest, Terry&amp
column3: s wife Monica is chairperson of the organization and serves as spokesperson.&lt

column9: is a cooperatively owned store, which offers healthy natural alternatives, and serves both members and the public. They sell abundant local organic produce and groceries in a farmer&amp
has a mission to be the leading year-round presenter of performing arts, film, and educational programs for the Southern Berkshires and neighboring communities.&lt

column1: Through programs of the highest quality in dance, music, theatre and opera, they ensure a diversity of talent on the stage of their newly restored historic theater. The goal of the Mahaiwe Performing Arts Center is to present available programs that appeal to all ages and interests.&lt
We are an active sponsor and participant in events at the Mahaiwe. We also provide parking for school buses when they host events for local educational programs.&lt

column9: has a mission to build a sense of community and common purpose throughout the region, and to enhance the recreational, educational, cultural, health and social well-being of the residents of the Southern Berkshires.&lt

column1: For many years we have provided sponsorship to Berkshire South and feel it plays a vital role in drawing our community together.&lt

column3: Information Regarding Local Businesses and Projects of Interest&lt

While there continues to be considerable concern regarding the state of the local and national economy, there are many signs of sustainable recovery and dynamic growth potential in the Berkshires. We have highlighted some projects of interest below:&lt
This project will reuse an historic local building to create class A office space enabling IMC to hire 50-60 new employees over the next several years. This will add to Great Barrington&amp

column1: The $4.2 million Main Street Reconstruction Project is designed to repair and replace failing pavement, drainage and utilities due to aging infrastructure. It will also address issues related to traffic and pedestrian safety and result in general improvements to the downtown corridor. The funding for this project comes primarily from the Massachusetts department of transportation.&lt
Predominantly vacant and unused for the last 50 years, the possible redevelopment/reuse of the Monument Mills is an exciting economic development opportunity for the Berkshires.&lt

column17: (dates will be posted under the seminars and events tab).&lt

certification, individuals must complete a comprehensive course of study at an approved college or university covering a multitude of financial planning topics, including:

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP
Board and violation of these principles can result in the revocation of the designation.

an unwavering commitment to the highest ethics
a steadfast commitment to putting your interests first.&lt

column3: Make the most of your site with new images&lt

To make the most of your website, consider having some new professional photos taken. The better your images are, the more visually appealing your website will be. Direct your photographer to this page for photo specifications or explore the information below for specifics.&lt
Having a good professional photo of yourself is a critical component of your website. We hear from advisors all the time that they don&amp
column5: t like to have their photo taken, but when a client or prospect comes to your website, they are going to want to see what you look like and they&amp
column7: re going to be asking themselves whether you look trustworthy, whether you look professional, and whether you look like someone they could have a conversation with.&lt

With strategic vision and an unparalleled dedication to responsible stewardship, our management team is helping reshape the way you might think about a full-service securities firm.&amp
As a client of RBC Wealth Management, you&amp

column1: .net,".net","","General","Preserve Your Wealth Across Generations With Wealt","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root clientId=""A6663:contentForm:j_idt11:content:j_id3"" xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content clientId=""A6663:contentForm:j_idt11:content:j_id4""><value>&lt
column3: Preserve your wealth across generations with wealth transfer planning&lt
Over $3.2 trillion is expected be passed down to inheritors in the United States within a generation. Yet, despite benefactors wanting to preserve that wealth for their descendants, it&amp
column5: s commonly observed by those in the industry that family wealth rarely lasts across multiple generations.&lt

column3: At RBC Wealth Management, we surveyed over 1,200 Americans with an average net worth of US$4.3 million to see how prepared families are to give and receive wealth&amp
column5: and we discovered that most people are woefully unprepared for either scenario.&lt

column2: video class=""video-js"" controls="""" data-account=""3835386791001"" data-application-id="""" data-embed=""default"" data-player=""B1nmIAHN"" data-video-id=""5304815492001"" style=""position: absolute

column3: Despite concern among benefactors that their heirs would not have the financial acumen to preserve and grow family wealth, 48% of respondents rely on family members to educate their inheritors. While financial conversations with your heirs are important, this informal approach alone isn&amp
column5: t as effective as tapping outside resources like your financial advisor, tax advisor and private banker to help educate your heirs. Additionally, the majority of heirs surveyed reported that they lacked key details on their inheritance, despite having talked to their benefactors in advance. For instance, only 31% were informed how their benefactors wanted them to use the assets they were inheriting.&lt

column3: Many people have a will in place&amp
column5: but a will is just the beginning. Our research reveals that only 30% of benefactors have a comprehensive wealth transfer plan in place. With relatively few people ready for wealth transfer, there&amp
column7: s no time like the present to think about how to pass on your legacy.&lt

column3: We encourage you to download the &lt
column15: for more insights into giving and inheriting wealth across generations. Then contact us to discuss how we can put a comprehensive wealth transfer plan in place and work together to make sure your heirs are well-prepared to carry on your legacy.&lt

column3: As part of our continuing series, we invite you to download the reports below to learn more about wealth transfer and:&lt

column3: Fixed income at RBC Wealth Management&lt
RBC Wealth Management is a leader in fixed income, with state-of-the-art technology, extensive offerings and a client-focused approach that will help benefit your clients.&lt

column2: video class=""video-js"" controls="""" data-account=""3835386791001"" data-application-id="""" data-embed=""default"" data-player=""B1nmIAHN"" data-video-id=""3880701674001"" style=""position: absolute

column3: When our clients are happy, we&amp
column7: s why we are committed to quality, offering the best products and services for your clients&amp
column9: unique goals. You have unparalleled access to a team of fixed income traders and strategists, as well as regional specialists whose expertise gives us a distinct advantage when evaluating bonds.&amp

column3: The Fixed Income professionals at RBC Wealth Management utilize industry-leading software and technology to provide a single, consolidated report of your clients&amp
column5: entire fixed income portfolio, including those securities safe-kept at RBC, as well as those that are held away. To assist us in providing you with the best possible service, we receive daily notifications of important events that affect the securities your clients hold, allowing us to discuss those changes with you as soon as they occur. &amp
column7: Further, we are able to stress test your clients&amp
column9: portfolio for areas of risk and opportunity, and create proposal reports to show the net effect of a transaction on your portfolio. These reports and notifications allow us to make well-informed strategic plans and proactively manage fixed income portfolios.&lt

column3: RBC Wealth Management offers a comprehensive suite of taxable and tax-free products, with thousands of unique offerings. Our open architecture provides you with access to internal as well as streetwide inventories, with every trade being reviewed by a trader for best execution.&lt
We invite you to watch our brief video above to learn more about the benefits of being a fixed income client at RBC Wealth Management. Please contact us today to discuss our platform capabilities.&lt

column1: At the Omaha Branch we promote an entrepreneurial spirit and believe in advisor autonomy. What does that mean? Two fundamental principles: Your clients are your clients. And your business is your business. As a financial advisor with our Private Client Group, you and your clients will benefit from having access to the world-class resources of a global leader in diversified financial services: our parent company, Royal Bank of Canada.&amp

Resources at the branch level that make us unique to many of our counterparts&lt
A commitment to professional growth through education.&lt

column3: Prepare for the future you want with RBC WealthPlan&lt

column15: %}we{% endif %} use RBC WealthPlan to help our clients prioritize their goals and address their concerns.&lt

column1: .net,".net","","Advisor Only","Special Considerations for Special Needs Children","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root clientId=""A3211:contentForm:j_idt13:content:j_id3"" xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content clientId=""A3211:contentForm:j_idt13:content:j_id4""><value>&lt
column3: Special considerations for special needs children&lt

If you have a child with special needs, you probably worry about what will happen to him or her after you are gone. Government assistance like Supplementary Security Income and Medicaid may be available for those who qualify, but what about day-to-day care or therapeutic and educational services they may need?&lt
A special needs trust may be the answer you&amp
column5: re looking for. We can help you set up a trust to provide the financial resources your child needs to enjoy a good quality of life while preserving their ability to qualify for important government benefits. And you can appoint a trustee to help ensure the assets in that trust are managed and distributed according to the best interests of your child&amp
column7: in line with your specific instructions, as outlined in the trust.&lt

column3: We invite you to watch Kevin, Denise and Kayla&amp
column5: s story and how we were able to help one family prepare for their daughter&amp

column3: If you have a special needs child or are interested in learning more about special needs trusts, please&amp
column11: d love to discuss how we can help you and your loved ones prepare for the future.&lt

column1: .net,".net","Rick S Friedman","The Friedman-Sepolio Wealth Management Group","About Our Team Content--6","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column13: Senior Vice President - Financial Advisor, Senior Portfolio Manager - Portfolio Focus&lt

column9: Before beginning my career in the financial services industry, I earned a BA in Finance from the University of Houston. In 1991, I joined Merrill Lynch, where I became a Certified Financial Manager. I joined RBC Wealth Management in 1999. In 2005, I earned the&amp
column27: ) from Rice University and an Accredited Wealth Manager from the University of Michigan. In 2005, I was selected to join the President’s Council designation from RBC Wealth Management which was reserved for the top 20% of the financial advisors at the firm. &lt
column29: Since 2012, I have been awarded the Chairman's Council designation from RBC Wealth Management, which is reserved for the top 150 financial advisors at the firm.&lt
column31: Based on my success in building a fee-based wealth management practice, I was selected to join RBC Wealth Management’s exclusive Consulting Group. I was the host of “Your Money” on Business Radio AM1320 for over seven years and a have been a weekly guest on Money Mondays seen on News24Houston. In 2009, I was named one of the top financial professionals focusing in retirement income management by &lt
column35: . In 2011, I was named as one of the Top Wealth Managers in Texas by Newsweek Magazine. I have also been named to the 2015 Financial Times Top 400 Advisors list in the U.S.&lt

column9: I am a native Houstonian, currently living in West Houston with my two children, Taylor and Joshua. We believe strongly in taking an active role in the community through a variety of organizations, such as SPCA, CAPS, Depelchin Children's Center and SIRE. When not spending time with my family, my interests include flying, golf, traveling and spending family time at our place in Chappell Hill, TX where I love working with my horses and cattle.&lt

column7: has been helping individuals make intelligent wealth planning and investment decisions for over 36 years. Our mission is to make a significant difference in the life of our clients through the application of proven wisdom, communication and a high level of personal service.&lt

column9: s trusted wealth advisor so our clients can experience financial freedom and spend time on what matters to them. We follow the CFP&amp
column11: Board Code of Ethics. This code requires&amp
column16: that we deal with clients with integrity, objectivity, confidentiality and, most importantly, to always act in our client&amp

column3: Our wealth planning process is holistic and continual in nature. We are skilled and experienced in generating wealth, development of strategies to preserve wealth, liability management, creative retirement income strategies and tax efficient transfer of assets to the next generation.&lt
Our approach is tailored to your personal needs. We help you define your investment goals, developed reasonable performance expectations and manage all types of risks. Our Advance &amp
column5: Protect investment strategy is a disciplined process designed to help you grow your assets with a focus on downside protection. This investment philosophy provides a framework that allows us to manage the constantly changing risks and thus help our clients protect their capital.&lt

column8: The Price Group will help you determine&lt

column3: where you are today, where you want to be tomorrow&lt
and how you are going to get there.&lt

column3: s Fixed Income Group is a leader in fixed income trading, sales, and public finance underwriting.&lt

column1: Comprised of over 600 employees in numerous cities throughout the United States, we serve individual investors, institutional investors, and municipal borrowers.&lt
Our regional expertise gives us a unique advantage in gathering and evaluating information on bonds issued in the areas where we serve.&lt

column9: This group fosters open, frank and productive communication between financial advisors, traders and strategists in an effort to deliver the most appropriate fixed income solutions to clients.&lt

column3: For more than 35 years, John has helped clients achieve their financial goals through forward-thinking investment strategies and market insight. He has built a loyal client base with current assets under management exceeding $250,000,000. John&amp

column23: s strongest international banks, allows John to provide his clients with world-class financial services.&lt

column1: .net,".net","Eric Shadoff","Eric Shadoff, CFP®","About Eric Content--5","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column5: Eric is a graduate of The University of Delaware’s Alfred Lerner College of Business and Economics.&amp
column7: He has a Bachelor of Science Degree in Finance.&amp
column9: He also was a four-year letter winner in NCAA Division I Soccer.&lt
column13: After graduating, Eric began his career in the financial services industry with Wells Fargo Advisors.&amp
column15: In January of 2012, he joined the Westminster, Maryland office of RBC Wealth Management.&amp
column17: In August of 2016, he moved his primary office to RBC's Baltimore office.&amp
column19: Eric continues to meet with clients in the Westminster office on a regular basis, scheduling client appointments and wealth planning reviews. &lt
column33: After completing the required coursework at the College of Financial Planning, Eric received his &lt
column49: a member of the firm's Consulting Group, an exclusive company designation reserved for financial advisors who have achieved a high level of success in building consultative wealth management businesses.&amp
column55: Currently, Eric holds his Series 7, 6, 63, and 65 licenses.&amp
column57: He is licensed by the Maryland Insurance Administration as well.&lt

column3: Eric enjoys being an active member of the community.&amp
column5: He is currently a member of both the Carroll County Chamber of Commerce Golf Committee and the Carroll Lutheran School Golf Committee.&amp
column7: In addition, he volunteers with RBC's environmental Blue Water Project.&lt
column11: Eric resides in the Federal Hill area of Baltimore City with his wife, Kira.&amp
column13: He enjoys spending time with family and staying active.&amp
column15: His interests outside of work include playing soccer, golfing, the ocean, and traveling.&lt

column21: Sandy began her career in financial services in 1979 with the Baltimore firm of Baker Watts &amp
column23: Co., which was merged into Ferris, Baker Watts, Inc. in 1988, and subsequently acquired by RBC Wealth Management.&amp
column25: Sandy holds her series 7 and 63 licenses, has received both quarterly and annual &lt
column27: RBC Wealth Management Awards of Excellence&lt
column29: , and currently serves on the Client Associate Advisory Board.&amp
column31: She provides excellent service and performs her responsibilities with a commitment to quality and client satisfaction.&lt
column35: Sandy was born and raised in the Baltimore area. &amp
column37: She currently lives with her husband and two Westie puppies in Baltimore County. &amp
column39: In her free time, she enjoys being with her family, gardening, spending time at the beach, music, and antiquing.&lt

column1: .net,".net","Gary K MacPherson","The MacPherson Investment Team","About Our Team Content--5","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column13: First Vice President - Financial Advisor, Consulting Group&lt

column7: ™ who remains convinced that the key variables governing a rational investment strategy are your goals and your investing time horizon.&amp
column9: The biggest retirement risk for Baby Boomers isn't declining markets, but rather outliving their money due to inflation and 30 plus year retirement horizons.&lt
column15: Financially speaking, retirement is an ""income problem"".&lt
column21: Chris specializes in creating Retirement Income Plans that help ensure that your retirement is built on a foundation of financial freedom and independence.&lt
column25: Chris was recently featured on the front page of the Business section of the &lt
column35: Chris and his wife, Lindsay currently live in Maple Valley close to their hometown and family.&amp
column37: They have two children, Nicholas and Katelyn.&amp
column41: When Chris is not busy chasing around the kids he&amp
column43: enjoys playing soccer, golfing, and watching the Seahawks and Sounders.&amp
column49: Chris is also an active member within&amp
column55: and enjoys giving back to his local communities.&amp
column57: The Bellevue Breakfast Rotary Club is currently building water projects in Kenya,&amp
column59: setting up computers for schools in Antigua, and&amp
column61: teaming up with local charities such as Kindering and Seattle Children's Hospital.&amp

column3: What does financial security look like to you?&amp
column5: Building a foundation, so that no matter what happens your future is safe, your children&amp
column7: s education covered, your retirement savings are on track, and you have a safety net should things go wrong. We can help with all of these.&lt

column3: What does retirement mean to you? Take a moment&amp
column7: d like to fill your days. Your ability to live the lifestyle you envision will depend largely on your ability to achieve financial independence during&amp
column9: your retirement years. Which is why you&amp
column11: ve worked hard, saved and invested.&lt

column5: ve spent your life working hard, enjoyed a wonderful retirement, and luckily, you have prepared financially. So well so, that you&amp
column7: re able to leave behind something to help your children, your favorite charities, and others that you care about.&amp
column9: We help ensure that when the time comes, your hard earned resources are passed on in the most efficient and appropriate manner that is aligned with your wishes.&lt

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP&amp

column3: How do I change the banner image?&lt
You can select from our library of banner images by logging in to your Veriday website, selecting Dashboard &amp
column5: Settings from your Digital Workspace, then clicking Settings, and finally the Theme Options tab on the page. Simply click the banner image you like and click Save Changes.&lt

column3: If you have had a professional photo taken according to our photo guidelines, please submit it to &lt
I would like more insight into how my website is functioning. Are reviews available?&lt
Yes, Veriday can conduct your biannual website review. You can call them at 888-461-1093 to schedule a review.&lt
How do I get access to the website editor?&lt
Find the link to access Veriday Digital Agent in the internal &lt
column7: located in InfoNet. If you have further questions, please send an email to &lt

column3: How can I access my analytics?&lt
Your analytics are available through your dashboard. Call Veriday at 888-461-1093 to learn how to access these yourself or to understand what your metrics are telling you.&lt

column3: For more than a century, RBC Wealth Management has provided trusted advice and wealth management solutions to individuals, families and institutions. We are a global organization, bringing our diverse expertise and deep knowledge to help strengthen the financial security of our clients around the world.&lt
With strategic vision and an unparallelled dedication to responsible stewardship, our management team is helping reshape the way you might think about a full-service securities firm.&amp
As a client of RBC Wealth Management, you&amp
column5: ll be working with a company with deep resources, a reputation for putting the interests of clients ahead of our own and a passion for helping transform the lives of the people we serve through customized wealth planning.&amp

column3: We provide a comprehensive suite of world-class products and services available to help you build, preserve, enjoy and share your wealth.&amp
We invite you to explore the links&amp
column5: above to learn more about what sets RBC Wealth Management apart and &lt
column11: today to see how we can help you achieve financial security.&lt

column5: s External Aggregation, part of the Total Wealth initiative, allows clients to sync data from held-away accounts, then view that information within the RBC digital platform. column1: .net,".net","Jacquelin R Larson","The Westside Group","Working With A CFP® Content--12","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column5: When choosing a financial advisor to help you meet your wealth management goals, consider the benefits of working with someone that is&amp
to individuals that have met rigorous educational, testing, and ethical standards.
certification, individuals must complete a comprehensive course of study at an approved college or university covering a multitude of financial planning topics, including:

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP
Board and violation of these principles can result in the revocation of the designation.

column3: Why It Should Matter to You&lt
column5: There are a variety of attributes that you can expect from an advisor with the CFP

column3: being well-versed in developing integrated wealth management plans
a robust theoretical and practical knowledge of investment products and services
an unwavering commitment to the highest ethics
a steadfast commitment to putting your interests first.&lt
We encourage you to experience the benefits of working with a CFP&lt
column11: today to learn more or to schedule a complimentary consultation.&lt

column1: .net,".net","Elizabeth Norman","The Norman Fletchall Team","Working With A CFP® Content--13","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column3: Working With A CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ Professional&lt
column5: When choosing a financial advisor to help you meet your wealth management goals, consider the benefits of working with someone that is&amp
to individuals that have met rigorous educational, testing, and ethical standards.
certification, individuals must complete a comprehensive course of study at an approved college or university covering a multitude of financial planning topics, including:

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP
Board and violation of these principles can result in the revocation of the designation.

column3: Why It Should Matter to You&lt
column5: There are a variety of attributes that you can expect from an advisor with the CFP

column3: being well-versed in developing integrated wealth management plans
a robust theoretical and practical knowledge of investment products and services
an unwavering commitment to the highest ethics
a steadfast commitment to putting your interests first.&lt
We encourage you to experience the benefits of working with a CFP&lt

column1: .net,".net","Deborah A Sullivan","The Sullivan Group","Gail Winslow Award","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root clientId=""A9492:contentForm:j_idt10:dynamicContent:j_id5"" xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content clientId=""A9492:contentForm:j_idt10:dynamicContent:j_id6""><value>&lt
column6: img alt=""It is with great pleasure and enormous pride that we announce that our very own Debbie Sullivan has been recognized by RBC Wealth Management-US as the recipient of the Women’s Association of Financial Advisors (WAFA) Gail Winslow Award for 2020. The WAFA Gail Winslow Award recognizes a woman at RBC Wealth Management, within the United States, who demonstrates exemplary efforts to help attract, support and retain female clients and financial advisors. The award was established in memory of RBC Wealth Management-US Financial Advisor, Gail Winslow, who was a trailblazer with more than 60 years in the financial services industry.   Ms. Winslow led many financial advisors and clients to paths of opportunity and success through her motto “clients come first.”  Debbie was recognized for her involvement with the WAFA group, her mentorship of women at RBC Wealth Management-U.S., her charitable work here in the Pittsburgh community and for her support of her female clients. Debbie is a strong proponent of helping female clients improve their financial literacy, especially in cases following a divorce or the death of a spouse. She was also featured as part of the RBC Wealth Management-U.S. Your Path video series, a national recruiting initiative to attract more women into financial advisor roles at the firm.  “This award means everything to me,” Debbie said. “To be recognized for something I care passionately about, and for something that gives me such fulfilment, feels like the culmination of my 35 years in this business!”  Please help us in congratulating Debbie on this wonderful honor!"" src=""/documents/276056/276124/Social+Media.png/69fa6298-e9af-4b24-8f33-ab0d98de3a31?t=1606231385936"" style=""width: 5000px

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

column1: .net,".net","John P. McCalla","The Wade McCalla Peete Investment Group","Working With A CFP® Content--9","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column5: When choosing a financial advisor to help you meet your wealth management goals, consider the benefits of working with someone that is&amp
to individuals that have met rigorous educational, testing, and ethical standards.
certification, individuals must complete a comprehensive course of study at an approved college or university covering a multitude of financial planning topics, including:

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP
Board and violation of these principles can result in the revocation of the designation.

column3: Why It Should Matter to You&lt
column5: There are a variety of attributes that you can expect from an advisor with the CFP

column3: being well-versed in developing integrated wealth management plans
a robust theoretical and practical knowledge of investment products and services
an unwavering commitment to the highest ethics
a steadfast commitment to putting your interests first.&lt
We encourage you to experience the benefits of working with a CFP&lt
column11: today to learn more or to schedule a complimentary consultation.&lt

column1: .net,".net","Erica Cummings","The Harmony Financial Wellness Group","Podcast info content","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root clientId=""A7538:contentForm:j_idt10:dynamicContent:j_id3"" xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content clientId=""A7538:contentForm:j_idt10:dynamicContent:j_id4""><value>&lt
column3: A Strong Woman for Strong Women&amp

When life throws a curveball your way, it can be easy to respond with a knee-jerk, emotional reaction. However, letting your emotions guide your financial decisions can derail you from truly experiencing financial success.&lt

column5: s why Erica Cummings and the Harmony Financial Wellness team have created a process to address this and to reconnect you with your rational brain.&lt

column3: In this episode, join Erica as she guides you through the B.I.N.D.E.R process. Erica breaks down the 6-step process and highlights how they each work to guide you towards rational thinking and an understanding of what truly matters.&lt
The importance of setting long-term goals&lt
How to create a roadmap for working toward your goals&lt
The value in having a community of individuals in similar financial situations as you&lt
Tune in now to discover the B.I.N.D.E.R process and how it could help you!&lt

column9: Introduction to Erica and the inaugural A Strong Woman for Strong Women&amp

column11: An in depth look at the Eight Dimensions of Strength&lt

ve learned that when it comes to finances, women have different needs than men. That&amp
column7: s why we created an exclusive segment called Empow(Her) Wealth Group, where we design wealth plans that address those differences, helping women reach their goals and plan for secure and fulfilling futures. Whether it&amp
column9: s balancing motherhood, demanding more pay on the job, facing divorce or loss of a spouse, being the breadwinner, the boss, planning for retirement, or just living longer, our financial expertise, smart investment strategies, educational seminars and resources, empower women no matter where they are in their lives. We help you understand your relationship to money and the story behind it. column3: Are you drowning in mail? Let me flip you over to paperless!&lt

column3: We believe in establishing life-long relationships built on trust and mutual understanding. With our BINDER Process, we develop wealth plans that integrate tailored recommendations with wealth management strategies designed for you and your family.&lt
Our gratitude is expressed by delivering high quality standards of care and service, and we encourage continuous education as the key to financial wellness.&lt

column1: .net,".net","Steve Davies","Steve Davies","Working With A CFP® Content--11","","<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8"" standalone=""yes""?><root xmlns=""http://www.veriday.com/xsd/content/content-base""><static-content><value>&lt

column5: When choosing a financial advisor to help you meet your wealth management goals, consider the benefits of working with someone that is&amp
to individuals that have met rigorous educational, testing, and ethical standards.
certification, individuals must complete a comprehensive course of study at an approved college or university covering a multitude of financial planning topics, including:

column3: Upon completion of the required coursework, individuals must pass a comprehensive, two-day, 10-hour examination that tests one’s ability to apply the knowledge they have obtained to real-life situations. &amp
column5: This test is considered one of the most difficult in the industry, with only a 55-60%* pass rate.

professionals must adhere to a strict code of ethics, upholding principles of integrity, objectivity, competence, fairness, confidentiality, professionalism and diligence when providing service to others. These standards are monitored closely by the CFP
Board and violation of these principles can result in the revocation of the designation.

column3: Why It Should Matter to You&lt
column5: There are a variety of attributes that you can expect from an advisor with the CFP

column3: being well-versed in developing integrated wealth management plans
a robust theoretical and practical knowledge of investment products and services
an unwavering commitment to the highest ethics
a steadfast commitment to putting your interests first.&lt
We encourage you to experience the benefits of working with a CFP&lt
column11: today to learn more or to schedule a complimentary consultation.&lt

column3: Honored to support the 2019 Polar Bear Plunge&lt
